There are several measures being implemented in São Paulo to improve air quality and reduce pollution in its urban areas:

1. Promoting public transportation - The city is working to incentivize the use of public transportation, including subways, buses, and trains, to decrease the number of cars on the road.

2. Encouraging the use of bicycles - The government has implemented bike-sharing programs and built more bike lanes to encourage citizens to ride bicycles instead of cars.

3. Implementing low-emission policies - São Paulo is implementing policies that require all vehicles to adhere to low-emission standards, including trucks and buses.

4. Reducing industrial pollution - The city government is implementing programs to cut down on industrial pollutants such as particulate matter and sulfur dioxide.

5. Green spaces - The government is creating more green spaces around the city to help reduce carbon dioxide emissions and increase air quality.
